page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT IN FRILSHAM
page.content: There is no long term{unemployment here. In Frilsham some still work on the farms as their fathers did but with widespread mechanisation the number needed has dropped. One man can milk 120 cows with machinery. Where ten men were once employed there are now two. Some men are now {self-employed}as electricians or builders. Many{travel}8 miles to Newbury or 10 to Reading to work. The local lime quarry employs two men. There is work for gardeners at big houses and at Brockhurst School. The Yattendon estate employs the largest number of locals. There is now a thriving{Christmas tree industry}from the conifers grown for this purpose in the woods. Women are employed here and in a light{industrial unit}at Yattendon. They work in the large houses or as home helps for the aged.
